channel.title: math.GM updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GM updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: A Perturbative Multiplicity Theorem for the Borsuk-Ulam Setting
item.description: arXiv:2507.11556v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove a generalization of the classical Borsuk--Ulam Theorem under small perturbations (shaking) of the sphere. We show that for a generic perturbation of a continuous map $f : S^2 \to \mathbb{R}^2$, the number of points $x \in S^2$ such that $f_\epsilon(x) = f_\epsilon(-x)$ becomes finite and odd, and may exceed the classical lower bound of one antipodal coincidence. In particular, we show the existence of maps with 3, 5, or 7 such points, and explain the unbounded nature of this multiplicity under higher complexity of the perturbation.
item.dc:creator: Karim Mansour
